msgSnippet: ... Is it? How is using a prefix in a name coupled to using inheritance? ... I think it will only be a matter of time until IDEs provide similar mechanisms for
messageBody:
Marvin Toll schrieb:

> It is the
> combination of inheritance + "test" that provides the method
> invocation solution.

Is it? How is using a prefix in a name coupled to using inheritance?


> In addition to code completion, having all
> like method names begin with a prescribed verb is useful for sorting
> methods. For instance, in Eclipse when one types 'Ctrl-o' followed
> by 'test' - you very quickly list the test methods in a class vs.
> supporting (perhaps private?) methods.

I think it will only be a matter of time until IDEs provide similar
mechanisms for annotations.

> Am I the only Java "guy" that finds benefit (on a fifteen
> developer project on two continents) in having a test method begin
> with he word "test"

Have you tried the other way? I just recently started using JUnit 4, and
I have to say that I like the method names without the test prefix better.

Cheers, Ilja
